title: How should I approach for AEE? - Quora
tags: Oil and Natural Gas Corporation Ltd. (ONGC)

response.answer_text: thanks for asking, first of all if you are preparing for APPSC AEE, then you have to prepare for next year as this year’s exam is over. how to prepare- first go through the syllabus thoroughlyscan the previous papers as u will get an insight about the level of questions.don’t ever take the GS part lightly because even through it’s lengthy and tedious to learn but it can fetch you good marks which will be very helpful to boost your score, as the questions which will be asked is just one word answers, and the exam will check only your awareness regarding that topic and not complete understanding, for example in the recent conducted exam, some questions were like-how many sectors are considered in the “MAKE IN INDIA ” initiative, answer -25full form of PMKVYThe length of AP coastline, answer -974 kmwhat is the target date of for implementation of GST, answer- 1–04–2017noble peace prize winner, questions on recent paralympicsso these are some the questions, and believe me if you are through with this part then it can be a bonus for you. now coming to technical part…. get your basics clearmug up all the relevant formulas, because if you observe the previous papers questions are very straight like if you know the formula, answer is very easy to get.give mock tests as it will improve your speed, accuracythe bonus part- as this exam doesn’t have negative marks, try to attempt all questions with 90% accuracy.in paper 3 the amount of syllabus is very huge so don’t cover all the topics as it will eat much of your time, go with only those topics which are important, to know that you have to scan previous papers 2 or 3 times.hope this answer will help you in your preparations. ALL THE BEST!

AEE preparation goes like any other exam preparation. 1)Understanding the syllabus is the success key 2)It is a two stage examination with prelims and mains 3)Paper 2:Since Strength of materials and Fluid mechanics and Hydraulic machinery Constitutes major weightage ,try to complete reading those two subjects first.Such that even if you don't crack AEE yet it definitely gives you an edge in AE exam. 4)Paper 3:Then comes remaining subjects like GT,TE,EE,Surveying,Building materials,Construction management, Structural analysis,WRE,RCC,Hydrology 5)The most important thing is to test yourself after completion of every subject for that you can appear for mock tests by Ace or made easy anything you like for that matter Solving previous year questions topic wise in particular will definitely help in understanding the type of question being asked and the difficulty level of it .It helps you in getting accustomed with the question paper pattern as well . 6)Coming to general studies,be sure to the point…Know the boundaries -keep your syllabus paper aside and prepare what exactly is needed.when it comes to economy in particular socio economic survey,budget,growth rates or any state development indices etc.make sure you are reading authentic data provided by the Govt of A.p All the best for your preparation.
